New Records: Tyrese Haliburton scored 31 points in the Indiana Pacers' win against the Boston Celtics.
The Indiana Pacers made 22 free throws, while the Boston Celtics made 16, setting a significant difference in the game.
Key Match Events: The turning point came when the Indiana Pacers scored 13 consecutive points to take control of the game after Boston tied it at 105-105 with 7:38 left.
The Celtics struggled from the 3-point line, making only 16 of 54 attempts after having 23 makes in their previous game.
Pre-Game Insights: Indiana coach Rick Carlisle emphasized a physical start and interior play to respond to a blowout loss, leading to a strong performance in the paint.
The Boston Celtics were missing key players Jrue Holiday and Kristaps Porzingis due to injuries, affecting their performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Boston Celtics coach noted the importance of the win as a step towards their championship goals.
The Indiana Pacers' victory was a response to their previous 37-point loss to the same opponent.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a rematch, and the Pacers' strategy of focusing on interior play was effective.
The Pacers' win marked a turnaround from their previous performance against the Celtics.
